item.title: AKS Azure CNI Calico IP Masquerade
item.description: Overview Recently someone raised a question because they were seeing their traffic source NAT to the node IP when using Azure CNI and Calico. I’ve covered this a bit when I dug into the Azure CNI and it’s impact on iptables in my Aks Networking Iptables in AKS post. The short version is that the ip-masq-agent that runs in the cluster has a matching configmap which tells it what ranges it should ignore for outbound NAT.
